reviewText:
This movie brought me in tears.  I could not stop laughing.  I've seen this movie doznes of times.  Just thinking about it makes me laugh.  This is hands down the funniest movie I've ever seen.

Funniest parts:  When perry sees his own action character; being hit in the face with the basketball; being caught in Oklahomos; basically every seen.

Enjoy
I have probably seen this movie about 40 times. This movie is HILARIOUS, it has to be seen to be believed!!!!!!!! I'd give it 10 stars if I could.

I know a lot of you think this is all scripted, that Perry is not real but some made-up character. Bollocks I say! Perry is as real as it gets. So are the jokes played on him! And to all you Perry-fans, you should also check him out in a movie called "The Bank Job", he plays a drug dealer in it. Good times.

Windy City Heat totally blew me away with how funny it was, sounds bad but I wasn't expecting much.  Forget that. This movie is hysterical.  You can see yourself pulling this on one of your buddies the whole time you're watching it.  Stunt Man!

Put quite simply, it's the funniest movie I have ever seen.

This movie is a gift and a curse. A gift in the way that You'll have tremendous, unbelievable fun watching it. A curse in the fact that, after seeing it, it will almost certainly consume your life. The universe of Perry and the big three go far beyond this movie. And you just want to experience every crumb of it that you'll spend months getting invested in the Perry universe that is changing and continuing even to this very day.

Also a curse in that you'll want everyone to see it, but you'll never reach that goal. Seeing this movie and understanding Perry is like being part of a very exclusive club. Those who have seen it understand and appreciate it. Those who haven't don't understand it- and are reluctant to even spend the time to watch it. It's hard to explain to people. This is the way it will usually go. You'll try to describe it adequately, and fail. Beg them to watch it, most won't. But the very few who do then join this very exclusive club. And then become what you are. Someone who desperately tries to get others to experience this movie with mixed results.

A coworker told me about this movie and I haven't looked back since. Here I am telling you that this is the best ten dollars you will ever spend. Watch this movie. Join the club.
Must see...great entertainme t
Great movie! Once you watch you'll be a fan for life!
Perry knocked over the table.
item as described

I love this movie. It is criminally underrated as it is a masterpiece of observing the human condition. The trials and tribulations of the hero of this movie, Peary Karamello, are amazing to witness.
His bravery shown in this humble offering of cinema excellence is something to inspire and enrich every viewer. Especially Randy Callihan.
For a lowly gypsy javaho to struggle with both his Italian heritage and his sexuality, while fighting with his friends whom are true saints, to reach stardom is a life lesson for us all to take away from this epic piece of living history.
Bless mr. Kimmel for not holding a grudge after the scare master sued him for nonexistent residuals and dooming the production of windy city heat 2 as well as losing any money that mr. Karamello could then give to prostitutes or spend on dog treats for his fake religion.
Thanks also for the comic genius of both mr. Barris and mr. Mole in the movie, as well the  hilarious big 3 podcast.
I wish I could continue to follow the adventures of our loveable dog worshipping, government scamming javaho, though it seems they have sadly split apart (hopefully for just the time being).
I will instead have to settle on catching up with Perry at the Denny's men's room on Reseda Blvd like every other man looking for greasy, hairy, Italian, man on man sexual release.
Please please please please please please please EVERYONE.
PLEASE watch this movie.
Between this movie and their excellent podcast, this might be one of the funniest things I have ever witnessed.
Bravo.

>Justin
funniest movie based on a prank ever
Awesome and amazing movie.  You've GOT to watch the extra features as well.  My sister was feeling sorry for Perry until she saw what a tool he is in the extra features.
A movie that has no real script because the lead character has no idea he is in the movie is amazingly well done. Funny and yet tells a story is brilliant!
Funniest movie of all time.  BIIIIIIIIIIIGGGGGGGGGGG THREEEEEE.
One of the funniest movies ever. Trust me on this.
Great movie. I loved the quality of the DVD. The two day shipping for Amazon Prime is amazing.

This is quite possibly the greatest comedy film I have ever seen. I watched it three nights in a row with different people and still laughed as if I was watching it for the first time. Do yourself a favor and watch this film.
love this movie, have wanted to own it for years.

This is honestly one of the funniest movies I've ever seen. Perry is clearly a little off as his friends constantly goof on him with his delusions of grandeur. I have watched this movie numerous times and each time I pick up another joke I may of missed. There are a lot of subtle laughs to look for and that's not even including the hilarious pranks pulled on Perry Caramello. The situations and hijinks are all cleverly done. This movie keeps you teetering back and forth wondering if the Perry truly doesn't understand that it's all a gag on him. It will keep you guessing to and that's part of the fun of watching. Do yourself a favor and buy this movie.
Bob cat is a genius
Laugh out loud kind of s***!

One of the funniest movies ever
Biggggg 3
Hilarious, i have bought this before and would buy it a 3rd time.
This movie is a classic!!!!!!!. Unadulterated comedy. Buy it, rent it, steal it. Just watch it. I promise you, you will laugh your butt off. I can not believe I didn't hear of this movie sooner.
GREAT
Best Movie Ever....drops mic
Big Thrreeeeee!
One word: Hilarious! Literally from start to end I was cracking up. I mean, how could a person be so oblivious to everyone being in on the biggest, most elaborate prank ever!?

Windy City Heat is pure, unadulterated genius. The only reason this film didn't get the accolades it richly deserved at the time of it's release (it was basically buried by the geniuses at Comedy Central) is because it was so far ahead of its time. There is quite simply nothing else like this out there, and never will be (unless the movie gods one day favor us with WCH2...?)
Funniest movie I have ever seen.  If you love this you will also love The Big 3 podcast which features the same guys and is even funnier.

Windy City Heat is one of the most original comedies in the history of cinema.  10 years after the original release of Windy City Heat the story continues today with the very popular "The Big 3 Podcast". Many twists and turns have taken place hopefully culminating in a sequel film, or reality TV show.  Hopefully Perry Karamello who is 100% real, doesn't completely screw up the whole project again.  He is a true scumbag!

Late to the party as usual, I first saw Windy City Heat in early 2012. It came highly recommended for years and I finally took the plunge. I can't remember the last time I laughed so hard!

I won't bother rehashing the plot, as several other reviews likely have. (check out Amazon's Product Description for a concise, spoiler-free explanation) What I will do is promise you this movie is INCREDIBLY FUNNY and the less you know about it before seeing it, the better.

It's a shame Comedy Central basically disowned the project, as it belongs in their Hall of Fame, alongside other legendary network originals like South Park and Chappelle's Show.

There's a wealth of hilarious mythology related to the "Perry Project" (as it was originally known) out there, but this is where you should start. Because believe me, once you do, you won't want to stop.

PS - My review title, about laughing so hard I worried I'd die, is absolutely true. In fact, it's happened twice..
Simply perfect. I am still laughing from parts of the flick. So many times I thought the character who they torment can not be real but then you see that it is real. What a buffoon.

Ugh.  Even if this weren't mean-spirited, juvenile, exploitative, and simple-minded, it wouldn't be funny.  If it had been made by a cast of high-school kids still cutting their comedy teeth, it might be noteworthy, but the only thing remarkable about it is the extent to which the production team went to fool the mentally-challenged Caravello.  The actual material isn't creative, isn't imaginative, and isn't entertaining.  I can see why this would attract a cult following, but I suspect it did so mainly because it can't hack it as a smaller fish in a bigger comedy pond.

Even though I knew Mole was an act, I wanted to beat him with the red bat.

This movie has no peers it is quite simply the most unique and hilarious movie ever made.
I have lost count how many times i have watched it and the good news is that it spawned the funniest podcast of all time The Big 3 Podcast. Thank you Don Mole and Scary Perry for giving me more laughs than any other medium that i can think of.

Simply one of the very funniest films ever made.  If you have not seen this film - you have no idea what you are missing.  Bunch of extras but the movie itself is the shining star.  And yes - Perry had NO IDEA this was happening because these guys had been setting him up for 10 years - it's the funniest thing you will ever see.

This is the funniest film I have ever seen in my life.  Windy City Heat has been my favorite comedy since I first saw it on Comedy Central many years back, and stands up to repeat viewings.  In fact, you'll pick stuff up each time.  Not only are there so many jokes and suggestive comments tpward Perry, but you'll miss them from laughing at the line before.  Don't miss the Big 3 Podcast, where Don and Mole continue to torment Perry weekly in an audio format.  You can find the Big 3 guys on Twitter and Facebook, too.  The other reviews have covered the plot well, so I'll spare you, but watch the first 20 minutes on You Tube and see if you aren't convinced.  I just bought 3 copies for Christmas gifts for friends.

After watching this movie you will be craving more and luckily they "The Big 3" have their own podcast and live webshow. If you haven't seen this movie rent it on Netflix and then you'll immediately buy it on Amazon.
its a great price for this DVD. i got it on time and it was very fast and easy to purchase.
A thinking man's comedy. Do not watch with someone who will ask you constantly "What's going on"? Mr. Caravello worries me.

Perry comes across as more sympathetic than he should in this. Good concept movie with some BRILLIANT gags in it. Worth a watch, and if you liked any of it you should check out the big three podcast. It's more of the main characters with scary Perry's true colors revealed... Not a great guy.

I would like to announce to all of Kerry Porabellos fans that he and I have decides to tie the knot. After our marriage, all are welcome over for a spaghetti dinner which Kerry will personally prepare himself. Perry decided that being with Dimitri Moreland was not a healthy relationship and wanted to rekindle the fire that was started over 20 years ago after he seduced me.
Also, make share to listen to the Big 3 Podcast and help support my fianc, Kerry Karramello

I wanted to like this movie, but i just couldn't get into it. Its a parody movie about the making of a movie where the 'lead actor' is a useful idiot and doesn't know he's being made fun of and takes himself and his crappy acting WAY too seriously. It just seemed like low hanging fruit to me as the 'mark', Perry, is just way too easy to make fun of. It was like watching an inside joke happening the whole time.

You can just smell it from early on that these 3 old friends are going through a well rehearsed skit (although the main character has such an earnest look in his eyes he almost pulls it off at times.)  This Christopher Guest tradition of bizarre improv needed more spontaneous situations.  I also dislike the constant Sam Kinison imitations.  I am among the generation that feels Sam's schtick is...not exactly "sacred", but shall we say "off limits."

I saw this movie once on Comedy Central a long time ago an never saw it again for years! I looked all over for it but never could find it, until I looked on amazon an found it! You can't imagine how happy I was to finnaly find this movie! I put that DVD in as soon as I got it which I don't do unless its a great movie, an it was just as funny as it was the first time! I laughed out loud almost the whole time, which it is hard for me to do becuase the movie has to be extreamly funny! I highly recommend you get this an watch it because it will instantly get you laughing. You can also watch this with your friends an family to have some funny stuff to joke an talk about.

What was done to Perry has to go down in history as one of the world's most elaborate pranks, surely.

But as for whether this movie is funny--ultimately what you care about--there's a problem.

There are about 4 or 5 extremely funny scenes, most everybody can agree.  However, they have all be leaked to a certain well-known video-sharing site which Amazon would probably prefer I not name.

But the problem is, you're going to be disappointed buying this if you've seen all those clips, because somebody posted the funniest ones.  What's left on the DVD, there's not much to recommend it.
movie is epic. lol the entire time. perry is hilarious. classic movie / top 10 all time comedy. ROFL ROFL ROFL
This was a an amazing prank to the highest level. perry is "Amazing" in this Film. Perry's double and triple takes are spot on and worthy of an award of some type.

The movie is one piece of an elaborate prank that has been played on Perry Caramello for the past 20 years. He's an aspiring actor who is narcissistic, massively homophobic (despite having a gay experience with a casting agent), and most of all, gullible. He's the real deal, and you don't have to feel sorry for him because he was paid 50 grand for the movie, and he's not a great guy (he assaulted his ex-wife, he files frivolous lawsuits, he wants gay people to die, he steals money from people's wallets). It's the perfect introduction to The Big 3 Podcast, which is basically the sequel to Windy City Heat. It takes the premise of WCH and spins it off into a weekly soap opera revolving around Perry's life.
This movie is amazing. Must watch. This is the cheapest place to get it and you won't regret it. If you follow these guys online or are a fan of the big 3 podcast you really need to watch this.

These guys are great. They've been pushing Perry's buttons for years now, and it's all been building up to this. Perry is completely CLUELESS as to what's happening, he totally believes that he's playing "Stone Fury" the entire time. Mole in particular is hilarious, his character's look/voice/behavior is ridiculous, I loved it. Definitely check this movie out, and check out their Big 3 podcast on iTunes. It's basically a continuation on the antics these guys pulled here, i.e. bringing up (constantly) the whole situation where Perry had sex with a man, having conversations with a pre-recorded phone call from John Quiny Adams (AHAHA) and updates on who Perry's suing now. BIIIIIIIIG 3!

Although this is arguably the spawn of the Joe Schmo Show, it might be one of the funniest movies ever made. It's definitely an acquired taste, but every time I see Perry's action figure I laugh for 5 minutes. Or the stunt double. Or the limo driver.

For reference, I'm a fan of comedies like Safe Men, The Royal Tenenbaums, Outside Providence, Beerfest, Rushmore.

HIGHLY recommended!

Windy City Heat is the type of movie that can't be explained. No, it can only be experienced. Place it alongside Fellini's 8 1/2 or holy scriptures, and they are revealed as vacuous pretension. Windy City Heat can only be compared to itself, as all else falters in its shadow.

Perry is NOT GAY!

Windy city heat is the Greatest comedy of all time. Perry has no Idea that this whole Movie is actually fake but Believes he's a big Star. I think even to this Day Perry believes this movie is real. To all the sceptics, I am a super fan of windy city heat and have watched this as many times as Perry has bitten the Bras off women... "Many Times". This is for real, Perry is not in on the gag. Bravo to the poeple who made this masterpiece. to have this many people in on the joke without blowing their cover is just incredible. If perry was in on the joke then he is indeed like a young Marlon Brando that he claims with great acing skills, but why isn't he a movie star now? thats because he was the victim of a great prank. I love Perry and want to hang out with him. This movie is super funny. youll either love it or hate it. Hopefully you will love it.

A friend of mine introduced me to this movie. He said it was one of his favorites...after watching it, it is now one of my favorites! There were some scenes where I actually had to pause the movie to catch my breathe (the basketball scene...and the food scenes with his assistant!!) I highly recommend this movie. Very few movies today are this funny without too much sexual content or vulgur words....Perry's preformance is 5 stars!!! Love ya, Perry, you now have a fan in me!

Picture if someone with the body of Ron Jeremy had a hairy, sloppy son with Rosie O'Donnell. Now give this person the glass-swallowing voice of a female version of Sam Kinison. Finally, make this person borderline retarded and completely oblivious like Jeff Daniels' character in Dumb and Dumber. This is "Scary" Perry Caravello. Perry stars as Stone Fury in the production of "Windy City Heat," and he thinks it's going to be huge. In fact, he mentions the Oscar's and thinks he beat out Brad Pitt, Schwarzenegger, and Harrison Ford for the role. He thinks the role of Stone Fury was made for him, and he's in full-on prima-donna mode, screaming at everyone on set and comparing himself to Steven Seagal, Robert De Niro, and Jackie Chan. Too bad it's all an intricate prank devised by his "friends," the actual movie is the biggest piece of garbage ever made, and all the acting is similar to three goons in The Spirit. Except those guys acted brain-dead on purpose. He's constantly getting dissed, nobody shakes his hand, and nothing goes his way. It's completely hilarious how he thinks he's a megastar upon his first day on set, yet everyone involved treats him like garbage. The set assistants put him in a raggedy trailer. The costume design people mistakenly dress him in The merchandising people make his doll look morbidly obese. The director has Perry thrown in a dumpster filled with manure. The abuse this guy mindlessly takes is brilliant, and he deserves every bit of it. He's possibly the most ignorant, jingoistic, racist, xenophobic moron in Hollywood (and that's saying something considering the city). If you hate egotistical Hollywood idiots, love the Three Stooges, and want to see a full movie version of Punk'd - a version that's actually funny - then this will have you laughing until it hurts. Congratulations goes out to everyone involved in setting this guy up like the Sissy Spacek in Carrie. Extras: Make sure you watch the extra of Perry and his two friends reviewing the DVD - called "The Reveal" - for the first time. He remains completely blind to the truth, and still gets a twinkle in his eye when he sees his performance.

OHhHH my FREakiN GodD!!!!  GeT ThE %$#@ oUTTa MY kiTCHEN!!!

Perry hits unnatural octaves when he loses his temper, which is like ever 5 minutes.  Geez this joke is so wrong, but so funny.  How can he not have a clue?

Staged or not, he does get to star in his own movie.  Everybody's in on the joke, except him.  Hilarious!  Poor guy asks for a stunt double, then realizes in utter shock his stand-in gets to have real sex with a hot Z-list actress.  Aww, shucks!  At least he also turned down the rimjob scene.

Thanks kegrun!  Greatest comedy/documentary along with American Movie.

A friend of mine told me that `Scary' Perry Caravello was in a skateboarding accident when he was younger. The accident made Perry, well, a little dense. His friends, Tony Barbieri ("The Mole") and Don Barris ("Big Lou"), well, they like to take advantage of Perry's denseness. They love playing practical jokes on him. And Windy City Heat is the king of practical jokes. Perry tries out for a movie called `Windy City Heat', and gets the lead role of Stone Fury, the sports detective! But what Perry doesn't know is that this is all fake and everyone is in on it. This is for real by the way. The movie we as the viewers watch is one very big joke. Perry never catches on. That's how oblivious he is. You might be thinking this sounds pretty mean, but Perry doesn't act retarded, he just acts...well...pretty normal, but not. To help hide the fact that this is a joke, his buddies tell him that all the cameras are for the documentary that will go on the DVD for the movie. As the fake movie is being made, many pranks are played on Perry, such as making him be thrown into a dumpster full of manure to add `realism', making him think the movie won't be finished because he wasn't able to guard a table of doughnuts, to him getting an award from the president of show business. He never catches on. The movie is filled with laughs and shocks. My roommate made me buy this so I'd watch it. While I was starting to watch it, I had no clue what I was in for, but after a few minutes in, I could tell this was a masterpiece. I almost feel bad for laughing at Perry, but, the way he acts, I just couldn't help myself. And good god, don't make him mad. When he screams, he sounds like a 13 year old girl not getting her way. His voice gets so high it's hilarious. I honestly don't see how he stays friends with Tony and Don. But it seems like he doesn't even remember the stuff they do to him after a few minutes. Many cameos are in here such as Dane Cook being a casting director, Bobcat Goldthwait (directing the movie we watch and the movie Perry is in), Adam Carolla, Jimmy Kimmel, Carson Daily (which provokes a great line I can't type here from Perry), and even ex-NFL lineman Refrigerator Perry.

I don't think this is for everyone, but man I found it hilarious. I definitely recommend a must rent. Make sure you watch the extras too for more laughs. Also, while I'm sure this is funny alone, this movie is perfect for viewing with friends... and beer.

P.S. - Perry says one of the funniest and most shocking things I think I've ever heard on camera. Seriously, who says that when they know they are being filmed? If you want me to say it I'll say it in my comments, but otherwise, it's close to end, and you will DEFINITELY know what I'm talking about when he says it. I rewound it three times to hear him say it. Friggin hilarious.

I read that Windy City Heat is %100 real. Meaning that the lead actor Actually Thinks that he's doing a real movie. The movies says so and it claims to be true online. With that, then it is insanely hilarious, however it's almost hard to believe he would be that dumb.

I was literally in tears in certain scenes. It's a bit insensitive once you realize the subject is probably a bit mentally challenged, but he appears to be having a great time the whole way through. Recommended for sure.

I usually don't go for "mean-spirited" comedy. You know, the typical fratboy humor, where people pick on one another endlessly. But, this is really really a funny flick. What makes it all worth it is the guy the joke is on; Perry Karavello. He is the perfect guy to mess with. A total goffball, insane, angry, idiotic, ect. Film makers are relentless.  But what makes Perry so great as the "butt" is his likeability. You gotta love this guy. Mole is my favorite. Fav scene: when the Mole and Big Lou dig into the catering on the film set and Stone Fury freaks out. One of many hilarious freak outs. Love this movie. Get a bunch of your like-minded friends together (you don't want any party poopers ruining the fun by saying things like, "that's so meannnnnnn'. or "ohhhhh, poor Perry"). Order five pizzas, roll some fatties, sit back and laughter will ensue!

This movie is nothing short of amazing. The only bad thing is there can never be a sequel.  I'll never forget the first time that I saw this movie on Comedy Central in 2003.  When the movie came on, I insisted that my friends and I watch it.  What transpired that night was the greatest TV experience of my life.  This movie is not meant to be watched alone. If you watch this movie with your friends, you will be quoting it for months.  I LOVE THIS MOVIE!
my son wanted this so I got him it for x-mas . he was very happy with it.

I'm not one for a lot of the movies shown on Comedy Central. However, I believe this is the single most hilarious film I have ever seen. When I was finished watching it, I had to buy it to show all of my friends. Everyone I know who has seen the film has been in pain laughing so hard. I don't know why this movie is not more mainstream.
The main character, Perry Caravello is the subject of an emmencely elaborate joke where he thinks he is the star of a fantastic motion picture. Despite the mock movie's terrible script, Perry truly believes he will become famous and even win an Academy Award. In the process of filming this rediculous movie, Perry is subjected to various pranks, including being thrown into a dumpster filled with manure.
The premise of this movie is pure comedic genius. You will find something new to laugh about it each time you watch it. I have seen Windy City Heat atleast 8 times and it remains laugh-out-loud funny. Add this film to your collection, as it belongs on the shelf beside Cheech and Chong, Animal House and the Blues Brothers.

I remember waking up one cold winter morning in Slippery Rock and turning this on as I woke up... I had to be at work in an hour... I called off just so I could watch the whole thing.  By far the funniest ANYTHING I've ever seen.  One of my favorite parts is where he gets the fresh fruit in his trailer every morning as a perk, while the other actors get a motorcycle and stuff like that... Oh, and the repeated dumpster dives.

"Could we get the manure wetter?"

Simply stunning that a film like this could exist.  Simply stunning that a character like Perry exists.  As mind-boggling as it is hilarious.

The real movie does not exist, yet in his commentary (done two years later), Perry talks about 'getting the role' genuinely as if it was all for real.  Though he does also make reference to it being like a reality show, he still thinks most of the situations were for real (BTW, you have to check out Burt Ward's appearance in the commentary).

At least I don't have to feel bad for Perry about what they did to him.  Hell, they gave him a wonderful ride.  In an extra, we see him watch the film with Mole and Barris (this film, not the 'real' one), and he has a glimmer in his eye every time he his honored (i.e. 'getting the role' and being given an award by the 'President of Show Business'--in fact, he gets choked up seeing the 'President's' award in the commentary).

Knowing him so well for so long, I believe Don and 'Mole' knew what they could get away with without Perry either catching on or being crushed in the end.  Which is apparantly ANYTHING.

He does seem to get a few things ('Roman Polanski,' Charlton Heston being fake, some of the pranks they played on him), but his thought to this day is that it was overall mostly genuine.

I am just glad to see that at the end of the commentary he feels his dreams were fulfilled.  And Perry, if you are reading this:  they were, my friend, they were...
One of the most unique concepts of seen. Like others are saying, whether it's real or not, it's still side-splitting hilarious. Don Barris and Mole do a killer job of playing along.

This is a great hoax.  Don Barris, Jimmy Kimmel, and friends spent years playing pranks on their gullible friend Perry before they finally got the funding to play one of the most epic pranks ever on him.  They succeed in making Perry think he is starring in a poorly written action movie.  He's such a narcissist, he never suspects it is a prank.  Unbelievably, he still seems to have trouble realizing the whole movie is a joke on him...or maybe the joke is on them since Perry actually did get to star in a movie called Windy City Heat!  Since then, they've been continuing the prank, telling him Johnny Knoxville is going to play his role in Windy City Heat - Part 2.

For those who think the movie was staged, I have first hand proof of the star's gullibility.  I e-mailed him through Myspace and offered him $5000 to host the opening of my new night club (I don't own a night club).  He called me about 10 minutes later and left me a lengthy voicemail explaining how happy he would be to do it because he "needs a good gig."

Call me crazy...but I hated it! Even though I REALLY REALLY wanted to like it!! : ( I couldn't even finish watching it. And Im all about being open minded..I mean I REALLY tried. No such luck. I bought it because Im a HUGE Dane Cook fan, and this was not typical for him..at all. Maybe it got better further into it..I dunno. Im sure there are lots of people that really enjoy this type of comedy. However, Im not one of them.

Frankly, whether or not "Stone Fury" is in on the joke or not is irrelevant -- this is one of the funniest, meta-level documentaries on the film business ever committed to film.  If Perry is "acting," this guy is a genius -- and the increasingly ridiculous situations he finds himself in build toward a hilarious, over-the-top conclusion -- with a drunk, lost limo driver and a wild ride through the windy streets of Chicago.  Special props to Bobcat, who underplays the director role perfectly, insisting that every communication he makes be done through a bullhorn.  A small joke, but reliably, consistently funny.

This is good good stuff.

There's some speculation both here and on the Internet about whether this is a mockumentary or an authentic prank played on a hapless wannabe actor named Perry Caravello. I suppose it doesn't matter, since it's never funny for even a moment. There is nothing funny about playing a practical joke on someone so credulous that he never suspects he's being put on, even when there are obvious clues (the casting director is named "Roman Polanski"). And if he's really an actor and a knowing participant, then it's equally humorless. I suspect the latter, because Caravello's timing, reactions and other signals tell me he is an actor playing a role.
What an awesome movie. By far the funniest thing I have seen in a long time.

I remembered seeing the better part of this on Comedy Central a few years ago, and am glad to finally have this in my collection. Watching Perry Caravello deal with the prank he's being set up for in this film is worth the price of two DVD's. I watched it back to back just to see if I missed anything. The extra pieces that are included on the DVD are just as hot! Watching Perry entertain his "friends" while they are still having their way with him is too intense at moments. Perrys veins are popping out of his head while his voice climbs two octaves while yelling at his co-hearts. For anybody that enjoys punk'd or mockumenteries like Spinal Tap, this is to the next level and is sustained the duration of the DVD. There are so many classic lines in this piece. I've been sharing this with my friends and always get them hooked after even just explaining the premise. This has got to be a cult classic by now, I know I would watch anything else these guys did that involved getting Perry to blow up. It would be so easy to lead this guy on, it's so obvious that they probably won't try anything to this level again. Glad to finally have this in the archive!

everything about this movie is great!  don't let the weird cover art throw you off.  (And don't worry about Dane cook's name on the cover - he is barely in it.  They probably just threw his name on there to encourage the d-bags that love him to buy this dvd.)

Perry is THE star; Perry IS Stone Fury.  The commentary and special features are wonderful!  After you watch this a few times, definitely watch it with the commentary.

Was not worth the money spent. I would have been happy with the product for around 10-15 dollars but Amazon's add on fees blew it way out of proportion.

I believe I ended up spending around 25-30 dollars for this cheaply, sort of pothetic documentry-type flick.

This decision will make me think twice when buying from Amazon compared to ebay or other online choices.

I've been a fan of this movie for years, ever since it first came out on Comedy Central. To be honest, I'm almost disappointed that it has become popular now - I can't surprise as many friends with its genius.  Still the extras in the DVD are great, if sparse.

The movie is so funny that many can't believe it's not actually scripted, but after about 4 or 5 viewings of this DVD since I bought it, I still believe it is the best practical joke ever played.

My wife and I saw this movie three years ago on Comedy Central and thought that it was the funniest movie we ever watched. Having to wait 3 years to see it again we were concerned that Windy City Heat may have lost some of its humor....We were absolutely incorrect! We love every part of this DVD (The deleted scenes and the reveal are hilarious). If you are into this kind of "Extreme Practical Joke" humor you will not be disappointed in Windy City Heat. I have watched this movie with friends and family and I know that at least two of them have ordered their own copy. This is by far one of the Funniest Movies Ever Made.

This is honestly one of the funniest movies I've ever seen. I laugh every time I think about it. Don Barris is one of the funniest human beings ever. Try checking out the Ding Dong Show; if you haven't seen it yet, you are missing out. And by the way, Don Barris and Jimmy Kimmel are NOT the same person. He does the warm-up for Jimmy Kimmel's show and if I remember right, he used to do it for the Man Show too.

There could not have been a more perfect mark for this movie than Perry Karavello.  I have seen this movie about a hundred times, and I laugh everytime. I can practically recite the whole movie.  Everyone should see this movie.

What a blast.  I watched this the first time with a bunch of mountainbiking buddies and laughed my butt of.  This is one the top 10 funniest movies I have ever seen.  Mr. Caravello is a treat.  What an entertaining joy ride, the fun never stops.  There are so much to laugh at in this movie.

This is one of the funniest movies I have ever seen.

It would had been even better had Jimmy Kimmell played himself instead of Don Barris (Kimmell's alter ego). There is no reason Mole could not have played himself either. While I can reasonably believe Perry is not familiar with historical figures, it is difficult for me to believe that Perry would not recognize that Barris is actually Kimmell and that Mole is not someone else. It is not only insulting to Perry, but to the audience as well.

Still, this movie is very funny and I don't care if it was real or not. Relax and enjoy it.

For almost 35 years, Star Wars (and the 5 other Star Wars movies) has been my #1 favorite movie of all time. Today (October 16, 2011), I'm officially bumping it to #2 and giving the #1 spot to Windy City Heat.

When this first aired, I couldn't believe how original the concept was, and how hilariously it was executed.  Now, a few yrs later, I've acquired the DVD including the "reveal," (SPOILER ALERT COMING)....

i don't get it - - i've watched it and am left confused.  does the "reveal" consists of perry watching essentially what was aired on tv, and he never had a reaction to it, like, "uh, this isn't a movie; it's all behind the scenes stuff" or whatever?

was there never a moment when it was explained that he wasn't starring in a movie, but rather a tv reality show/movie?  did he never need one?

what do you all think of the "reveal" scene?

thanks

If one had to rate something merely on ambition, 'Windy City Heat' would, without question, deserve five stars.  It is perhaps both the best and worst example of cinematic exploitation I've ever seen, and because I've become so desensitized over the course of my life, I commend the film far more for the former than the latter.

Now the question of whether this is 'real' or a [...] has come up, and frankly here's my thoughts on it: it's real, or at least, most of it is.  If anyone is doubtful of this, they need but to watch the extra features on the DVD.  Perry Caravello, the real-life 'actor' and the film's focal point for mockery, is indeed a real person.  In 'Windy City Heat', he plays the role of himself, to us, the audience; to his deluded mind, he plays the role of 'Stone Fury', the star of a Hollywood action film in the making.  Questions inevitably arise because, naturally, anyone with half a brain watches with utmost skepticism.  Surely nobody in Caravello's position could be so ignorant of the events that take place?  But, yes, somebody could -- Caravello himself. The story, as one becomes familiar with through the extra features, goes a bit like this:

The two guys who play Caravello's sidekicks in 'Windy City Heat' (the absurd, fake film) -- Tony Barbieri as "Mole" and Don Barris as "Big Lou" -- have actually been screwing around with him for like, a decade. This becomes apparent as one views the extra footage on the dvd, which demonstrates short clips of Barbieri and Barris harassing Caravello, all the way back to 1996. And it's not staged... completely real.  Barbieri and Barris -- who I might add are ...awesome... here -- are the type of guys who transcend shame and empathy for outrageous, condescending comedy at the sake of a mentally challenged 'entertainer', in this case Caravello.  They had basically mastered this circus act over many years, and that it all comes together so perfectly in this film isn't quite as perplexing when you're able to understand this.  And, again -- especially after viewing the films numerous times; I have seen it four -- one ultimately realizes that Caravello is, in many respects, retarded; his obviously demented behavior lends credibility to the whole 'it's real' thing.  If, in fact, Caravello 'was' performing all of this as an act, I'd personally think him to be the next Pacino, because no Human being can emulate a persona like his so utterly convincing.

And so, the joke goes on from there.  Everyone in the film takes stabs at the situation, and while it's usually hit and miss, it's always entertaining if only for the premise.  Take, for example, Perry getting thrown into a dumpster of manurer for a 'more realistic approach'.  Or Perry chugging a blended pizza, donut, and beer not once, but twice for a scene.  And these are just the most obvious examples of how they mentally screw with the guy; subtle gags literally run through the entire thing, rarely letting up.  My favorite, personally, is when they get to the "merchandising" of the film, and each of the three leads are shown their action figures.  Mole and Big Lou's are presented first, completely normal and visually representative of themselves; Perry, on the other hand -- after a drum role by the crew, to add effect -- is shown his figure... the most grotesque little doll imaginable, with a green face, huge gut, his face gawking sideways, seemingly ready to hurl.  The figure is "so" impeccably perfect that just the thought gets me rolling.  Perry's reaction is cut quickly but obvious -- he doesn't know what to make of it, but is somewhat sure that something isn't right.

The film needs to be seen to be respected, though it's definitely not for everyone.  The bottom line is most of us 'DO' find this stuff hilarious, even if it's in bad taste. There are a variety of human beings on this Earth, some smart, some not so smart.  It's part of the ever-progressing humor we seem to take on as a whole collective these days; cynical mockery of the bizarre circumstances found within the reality we live in.  And hey, if a guy like Caravello can make it through this impossible set of circumstances shown in the film, I'm pretty confident that, at whatever point he found out the trick was on him, he didn't sink into an everlasting state of psychological despair.

If 'Windy City Heat' were more consistent through its run, I'd be honored to award it five stars.  Due to its sheer originality and its stunning ability to ACTUALLY PULL IT OFF, I really want to give it a perfect rating, but alas it is slow at times without much laughs for often minutes at a time.  But when it strikes, oh lord how it strikes the most radiant of gold.

Update: I was just reading about Perry's life, and I don't know if this information is correct, but it's been said that he was actually an intelligent, suave, good guy, but was in an automobile accident in late high school. This really makes me sad, actually, and I'm really interested in this weird guy now. Anyway, I just found it strangely profound, that he's possibly this way because of horrible circumstances early in his life, pondering the thought of how his 'previous' being -- before the brain damage -- would look upon all of this. Again, sad...
